result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant pleas not guilty, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

11:37 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant John P Weber in court.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for John P Weber.  Attorney Patrick Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests counts 1,2 be found transactionally related. No objection. Court so finds. Witness J.C. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. Defendant identified. Cross exam by Atty O'Connell. Re-direct by State. State moves for bind over, waives argument. Defense objects to bind over, waives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over to branch 13.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LRG or any immediate family member of LRG.
